intro: Mentha baudrillartii, commonly known as the alpine mint, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its square, hairy stems and opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often grayish-green in color. The plant produces small, pale blue or purple flowers arranged in whorled clusters, typical of the Mentha genus. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Mentha baudrillartii is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
